primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God breaks into a world ruled by sin and death to deliver a people who are incapable of saving themselves.

subject.identificatie: God / The Master of the House
tekstueel_bewijs: God will come, and his justice will prevail
he will destroy evil and pain
The day will dawn on us from on high
to give light to those that sit in darkness
the promise that, against all the evidence, there is a God who cares

ontvanger.identificatie: The least, the last, and the lost / The Church
tekstueel_bewijs: those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death
the One who hung on the tree, accursed for our sake

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, Iniquity, and Human Illusion
tekstueel_bewijs: delivered us into the hand of our iniquities
the world ruled by sin and death
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a power that delivers humans into captivity, and death is a shadow that only a 'burst of transcendent power' can break.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church/Hearer waits and watches in the darkness, refusing cheap comforts.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (watching) is only possible because of the primary program (the promise of the Master's return).

voorbeelden_mens_subject: We have all become like one who is unclean

voorbeelden: commands the doorkeeper to be on the watch
the more you will want to immerse yourself
Advent teaches us to delay Christmas
human race cannot expect to receive any lasting comfort from this world

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes human 'non-pouvoir' (inability) in the face of sin and death, making God's 'pouvoir' (transcendent power) the only solution.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Darkness) through the negation of ~S1 (refusal of cheap comfort) toward S1 (The Burst of Light).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved eschatologically: God breaks in from the outside.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is treated as an ontological reality, not just a mood.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies the human condition as one of total helplessness ('delivered into the hand of iniquities') and places the agency of rescue entirely on God's 'burst of power.'

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the Pan Am widow
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: she has given herself in service to others

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God will come, and his justice will prevail
world ruled by sin and death

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Isaiah, the Doorkeeper) are used to describe a state of being or a posture of waiting, not as moral models to emulate for salvation.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: The doorkeeper waits because the Master is the one with the power to return.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief through the acknowledgement of reality; hope based on external rescue.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic rescue in the primary program.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The ethical program of 'watching' and 'solidarity' is perfectly nested within the soteriological reality of the 'Time Between.'

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: he will destroy evil and pain in all its forms, once and for ever

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses more on the Christological and Father-centric 'breaking in' than the internal work of the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is a dungeon and a hand that holds us.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by God's future action upon a helpless present. The actantial roles are correctly assigned for a theology of grace.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Strong emphasis on Pouvoir (Inability vs. God's Power).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for Advent I.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in grace-oriented preaching that does not flinch from the Law's diagnosis of the human condition.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'darkness' imagery, semiotics reveals that the darkness is an 'Opponent' that only a 'Subject' from outside the system can defeat.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical context of Isaiah; semiotics shows how the preacher uses Isaiah to establish the 'Receiver' status of the modern hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas's model exposes that the 'scented candles' are false 'Helpers' that fail to provide the 'Pouvoir' needed to overcome the 'Opponent' of death.

appendices.notities: The sermon follows Fleming Rutledge's own homiletical theory perfectly, as she is the author.
